ai-tha-ap363:0.3_0: the Elder Tāvatiṁsa (Divinities), the Lord of the World
ai-tha-ap363:1.3_0: I took ahold of the Vedas,
ai-tha-ap363:1.4_0: such a one, the great hermit,
ai-tha-ap363:2.1_0: When you’re sitting there for immersion,
ai-tha-ap363:2.2_0: I dropped the simile of the tamed me.
ai-tha-ap363:3.2_0: As a bird was worshipped by the flowers,
ai-tha-ap363:3.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap363:4.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap363:5.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Saṅgārava.
